website_summaries.verdict: Able to capture high quality 4K video and available up to 256MB, this is a good option for users who want to shoot a lot of 4K video without running out of storage space.
pros: Samsung's SDXC writes up to 90MB per second, and can accurately capture 4K video in smartphones, action cameras, and other devices
This model is available in four different sizes
For 4K video users, the 256MB option can prevent running out of storage space and losing shots during longer video sessions
An adapter for viewing and transfer in other devices is included
cons: Some users report that performance is reduced when the card gets too hot, a problem mostly in large devices like laptops or warmer climates

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality and durability
customer_reviews.text: I am done with Samsung micro-SD cards. Bought 2x 64 GB Select cards and one died after 2 years. I just got a 256 GB Select card and it came DOA. I own 18-20 San disk cards and ALL of them lasted far beyond warranted lifespan. Samsung usually makes good products but their SD cards do not seem to be reliable. Do not keep anything of value on them.
customer_reviews.author: Brent B.

customer_reviews.title: Good for up to UHD 30 FPS, not UHD 60 FPS
customer_reviews.text: This card works as intended for 4k recordings with no problem. If you want it for 4k recordings make sure it's class 10 and U3, which this is. I have Samsung Note 9 and the only negative thing I notice that when recording video in the highest resolution (UHD 60 FPS) it will not save it to this card, it will be saved to the internal storage of the phone. If you record in the second highest resolution (UHD) which I believe it's 30 FPS it will save to this card with no o problem. So you will have 2 Camera folders with images in your Gallery app. Other than that it's a good card.
customer_reviews.author: wudini007

customer_reviews.title: 4 Cards DOA??
customer_reviews.text: I got 2 cards, neither was detectable in on my computer, printer, or ip camera. Actually to be specific, one of them was detected after a few MINUTES in the computer, but I was never able to get it to respond enough to format it (I thought that might have fixed it). I did a back to back test with another micro sd card that I already owned, and it worked fine, as expected. Amazon sent me 2 replacements - same thing, tested on 3 different devices, to no avail. Extremely strange...
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Yikes might have received defective 256GB one
customer_reviews.text: I'm uncertain whether the one I received was defective or not, but it constantly unmounts by itself and restarts my phone when doing so. I've had calls ended abruptly because of it. The speed definitely isn't what adverised either. The writing is half, 50 MB/s at peak. I was hoping for a trustworthy 256GB Micro SD, I normally trust Samsung with them because of good prior experiences. This was unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: Mortem

customer_reviews.title: 256GB over hyped burn -- won't fall for it twice
customer_reviews.text: dismal 60Mbs read & less than 20Mbs write on Samsung S7 256GB supposed to be fastest size, cannot even get close to matching minimum U3 SPEED rating. NEVER AGAIN
customer_reviews.author: --jm

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: This was a complete waste of time. My son was in a rush to get a new card so I made sure this card was sold and shipped by Amazon. We got this in a plastic bag with the card and SD adapter floating in the bag and not in the cardboard bubble pack that I am used to receiving. Our suspicions that this may be a fake was only confirmed by the hanging of the format screen in his GoPro. I tried then to format it on the PC but the PC hung. I know Amazon will take it back but total waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kwak

customer_reviews.title: It's real!!
customer_reviews.text: It's real! I was worried about receiving a fake SD card because of some other reviews. I've purchased the 128 gb before and luckily no problems. I needed a bigger one now so I was hoping for the same luck. I figured if it was fake, I could just contact Amazon for a return. My Surface says it's 238 gb and not 256, but close enough. I'm just really happy it's real! It works great for my Surface Go. The old 128 gb I have is going to go into my dash cam.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa G

customer_reviews.title: Quick Replacement Policy
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this card 3 times before and have had no problems with it. I purchased a 4th recently and when the card arrived it would not work. I tried it in several items, including ones which already had the same SD card installed, and it would not function. I contacted Amazon and they sent me a new one, which I received in two days. They also had UPS pick up the failed one for return shipment. The new card functions fine. It is great to deal with people who stand behind what they sell. If you need a SD memory card, you can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: C. Scroggs

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this on my DJI, recording at 4k 60fps. It's been working flawlessly even in summer temperature when the device gets even hotter, and leaving it to record continuously for hours. There are no stuttering like the other slower cards. I'm not sure about transfer speed since I usually let it happen in the background, but I don't remember waiting too painfully long. It works so well that I bought another one about a year later. For 4k 60fps on a 256GB, my DJI indicates that there is enough for almost 6hrs of recording.
customer_reviews.author: Gc

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Better than Sandisk
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Had it for almost 2 years now. No corrupt data, unlike the old Sandisk I've had before this. I'd say this is a good investment, even though it cost more than Sandisk. Although Sandisk has a good warranty, they can't replace the data you lose. Got this to replace my Sandisk 64GB. After 2 years the "Sandisk" had problems, I had to get it replaced through warranty. After another year, same problem again, replaced through warranty. Lost a bunch of data on the Sandisk. My wife has the same Sandisk 64GB on her Note 10 and it has data corruption problems too. Buy this Samsung micro SD card instead. SANDISK IT TRASH.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.... for 5 months.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with my Nintendo Switch. After five months of use (where I never removed it from the console), the Switch started complaining that the SD card had been removed (and I should shut down before removing - duh.) I tried reseating the SD card to no avail. I tried reformatting the card (on PC then again on the Switch) which worked for a day or so, then started getting the same error. I tried a different SD card in my Switch and it is working just fine. Only this particular card is giving me errors. So, not exactly good value for only 5 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: M. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: seriously jacked up
customer_reviews.text: i got two of them. both have the same issue where on my computer and in my phone, the sd card claims its a 512GB and 256 is used up by nothing. leaving 256 useable by me. which works enough. but is very odd. and i know some phones wont recognize a 512 gb card. on top of that, this sd card makes every app i install on it hang badly from time to time. app works but every minute or so it just freezes from 1-5 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: moodapiller

customer_reviews.title: Own several of the 256gb models
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunch of these. There's one inside my Kobo-Glo that I modded to no longer suck. One in my dash-cam which is so far holding up to the read-write cycle (get the biggest you can for longevity). I have a couple in the package just waiting to use as backups even. This is(was?) the chip you should get for value-vs-performance. I've been out of the market for a while, but every one of these that I have is still functional and in a device that I still use.
customer_reviews.author: D3N1Z3Nx

customer_reviews.title: Needed memory card for Go Pro
customer_reviews.text: We're taking a family Vacay and I just bought a Go Pro so I figured I would get tons of storage space since it does 4K. This bad boy can store up to 8 Hours of 4K at 60 Frames per second without skipping a beat. So every day I would just record any and everything then just download it to a portable drive on my laptop so we got tons of footage. Also in case you're wondering it's a Go Pro Hero 7 Black and there were no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: LoveMeSomePrime

customer_reviews.title: Great SD card especially for laptops.
customer_reviews.text: The SD card is great given how much space it adds to your laptop. If your laptop has SD card slot, I suggest buying as it occupies small amount of space compared to external SSD. Additionally, the read and write spreads are fast so transferring files is very speedy. I would recommend it for anyone who needs that boost in space on on their laptop as it small, cheaper than other options, and offers a reasonable amount of space.
customer_reviews.author: MDAHASANUL K MIAH

customer_reviews.title: Works well in Dash camera
customer_reviews.text: I was needing a high quality memory card with fast write speed for my dash camera. Also wanted a card with large capacity as videos are large in size. After a year of use, I am very happy. I have had no issues with loss videos or damage videos. Came with SD card adapter so I can plug it into my computer to download the videos.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Allyn

customer_reviews.title: Not UHS Class 3
customer_reviews.text: This product was either defective or fraudulently packaged/advertised. See the benchmark for yourself. 13.2 MB/s write and 34.9 MB/s read. These are raw disk read/write metrics using specialized disc benchmarking software on an i7 processor laptop. I could see a 10% or so deviation from the advertised speeds for one reason or another, but this is not close. I have requested a return. This is barely a Class 10 device, and nowhere near UHS Write Speed Class 3, as advertised, let alone a 90 MB/s write and 100 MB/s read device. Maybe mine was a dud, but I wouldn't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Chase

customer_reviews.title: Real 256GB card
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Samsung 256GB microsd card to expand the storage capacity on a Nintendo switch. The card is legit and I am happy with it! You have to be careful buying SD cards, so many fakes out there! The price ~$27, plus 15% credit to Amazon store card was a steal, so I purchased 2!
customer_reviews.author: Raging45

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and time!!
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone says these cards are trash. Doesn't register more than half the time you plug it in and doesn't report the data on it. I doubt they are truly samsung cause samsung wouldn't release this garbage to the public. I ordered a 256 gb one which was trash and 512gb one that at this point is working but I have no faith in it. I own tons of samsung ssds and tons of samsung products and I have never had issues. I assume this is from this particular seller that pretends to be samsung and just total crap. Give me my money back you rip offs. Would give zero stars if possible.
customer_reviews.author: C Mast

customer_reviews.title: Black Friday deal 2019
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year on black Friday 2019 for my note10+ but I end up putting the Samsung sd card 256GB on my s9+ since i use it for mobile gaming alot and other things and my note10+ already has alot memory. The only thing I don't like is when I put on my phone it only gave me 246GB and not the full 256GB but I can't complain now so far works well on my s9+ and the download and saving pictures is super fast to move to my SD card i havent had problems knock on wood so far still have alot memory so good buy on black Friday :)
customer_reviews.author: NaNa

customer_reviews.title: Tested and good
customer_reviews.text: This card tested good. Here are the results: Samsung EVO Select 256GB: Black Magic Speed Test: Write: 65.9 MB/s Read: 90.3 MB/S Format exFAT: Warning: Only 244152 of 244160 MByte tested. Test finished without errors. You can now delete the test files *.h2w or verify them again. Writing speed: 65.7 MByte/s Reading speed: 89.3 MByte/s H2testw v1.4 Format Mac OS Extended (Journaled): Warning: Only 243893 of 244192 MByte tested. Test finished without errors. You can now delete the test files *.h2w or verify them again. Writing speed: 66.6 MByte/s Reading speed: 89.5 MByte/s H2testw v1.4
customer_reviews.author: Florida Cracker

customer_reviews.title: It's plenty fast for burst shots & video.
customer_reviews.text: I will start by saying that I had to order this micro-SD twice. First one came to me with the plastic blister carefully sliced & a 64GB instead of the 256. This was obviously an Amazon issue & does not reflect on the product in any way. I work in IT & I try to stick to the Samsung 800 series SSDs when I can because they have excellent performance. For that reason I stuck with Samsung for the MicroSD flash card & it works as hoped. Sometimes these SD chips aren't fast enough for burst pictures or smooth video. This not Samsung's top offering but it still performed as well as I'd hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Best quality and value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great Product. It has good specs, a good price particularly if you research a bit from the same manufacturer as my phone and it works. That's about all you can ask for. You can find them cheaper but with far less performance (could hang you up on video playback) and even more expensive with lesser specs (what's that all about) and it is amazing how the price of memory has declined over the last fifteen years. I still have an 8 meg SD card in an old camera case with a $39.00 price.
customer_reviews.author: Redfour5

customer_reviews.title: Dash cam files frequently getting corrupted.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for a memory card. Have had a few corrupted files from my dash cam. Unfortunately the corrupted files were exactly the video files I needed, but of course...Murphy shows up and the worst happened at the worst possible moment for this card. Have since bought the endurance memory card and have had zero issues. Frequent corrupted files -2 stars
customer_reviews.author: D.Schibel

customer_reviews.title: CORRECTION on previous complaint
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a review that indicated the microsds appeared to be forgeries intended to scam buyers. I have since discovered that my chip reader had an old chip in it that was overriding the microsds and making them appear to be something else. I did not discover the error un til I got microsds from a different source and found they read the same. When I removed the old chip I found those newer microsds were as advertised. I cannot say anything about this sellers product, as I did not check them with a working reader.
customer_reviews.author: R. Nealon

customer_reviews.title: Legitimate product.  Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I had problem using SD adapter because it shows the card as protected. After about 7-8 adapters and different pc's, I gave up. I found an old USB card reader, plugged it in and got 20MB/s. I then bought a USB 3.0 card reader and got 80 MB/s. That's very fast. To verify the capacity,I copied about 240 GB of video files and they all worked. So it is definitely a 256 GB micro sd card.
customer_reviews.author: A Ray of Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Good price, fast enough and reliable
customer_reviews.text: It's a Samsung MicroSD, it works, it's reliable and it's a good price for the capacity. I don't buy Sandisk anymore, I've had a few failures, why take the chance, I know it probably isn't fair to blame Sandisk, but I do ;-) I've got several Samsung MicroSD cards, including at least a couple of 'green' ones, they've never let me down. I don't buy any others now. I use this to maintain my Onedrive files on my Dell XPS13 it's in the machine all the time, and it's never complained and it's been working reliably for weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: It was delivered but it wasn't there,,,,, lol
customer_reviews.text: I bought a card else where because this one said it was delivered but I never got it. But oh well. No biggie. Lol someone needed mine worse than me. But I bought another that came with a reader and adapter all in one package. Highly recommend this ad card. You can put alot of stuff on it. I use it for my mom who has M.S. and she cant do anything but listen to her Bible stories and old time radio shows. I tried to ask about how to get another card to replace the one that was supposed to be there but to no avail. But thank you anyway ! Jack
customer_reviews.author: 429 Cobra Jet

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from 128GB  to this 256GB one and it works perfectly on my Nintendo Switch.
customer_reviews.text: Giving my 128GB one to a friend of mine that's about to get a Nintendo Switch in a few days from now. This one's real good and affordable. I thought a lot about getting a much cheaper unknown brand Micro SD card on Amazon since I didn't have much to spend, but in the end I didn't wanna take any chances with the cheaper ones since they had many mixed reviews. Since my older 128GB one also happens to be a Samsung brand that I got from the store back then and never had any problems with, I thought I should just stick with Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Mahdi

customer_reviews.title: Great memory card
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get a micro sd card to increase the phones storage to the max to hold videos and pictures. I purchased the bundle which included the 256gb card and a Sabrent SuperSpeed 2-Slot USB 3.0 Flash Memory Card Reader. This genuine Samsung memory card works great for my purpose and it meets my expectations with less worrying about transferring. It's hard for me to keep up with what makes one different from another but this was the highest rated card recommended for my LG V40 phone.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: can't tell it's not internal storage!
customer_reviews.text: Mine works seamlessly on my Moto X4 Android One phone, and then I pop it into my Microsoft Surface Pro (2017), and once again, it's as if it's internal storage. Android is a pain -- many apps don't allow you to set storage location, and even those that do are sometimes cryptic as to how you set it. But that's a criticism of android, not this SD Card. So far, access time (read or write) seems just as fast as internal storage. But I don't yet have much on the SD Card, so will update later if it turns out to get sluggish when the Card gets more full. The item I received seems to be genuine Samsung (white edge).
customer_reviews.author: Contrary Mary

customer_reviews.title: You should get this for you phone
customer_reviews.text: This was a good buy decent write and read speeds for my phone. I used this on my cameras and other electronics. this a good card but I think the price is a bit high for this cards try to get it on sale if you can.i will keep a eye for deal are as this item go on sale quiet often. this is one of the best cards when it come to price value. Try to get a 64gb and up its not worth buying the 32gb anymore due to the fact file are getting bigger not smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Jackoutofthebox

customer_reviews.title: Fast, cheap, high capacity. What’s not to love?
customer_reviews.text: The pace of price drops for MicroSD cards is astonishing. At this price, just a couple of years ago I’d be reviewing a 32 gb card. I’m not one for investing a ton of time into reviewing these things, and I’m sure there are many other reviews with in-depth speed tests, but I will say that it’s been very speedy for me. Using a reasonably high speed USB-C memory card adapter, and flashing Raspian onto this card for use with a Raspberry Pi 4b (why I bought this card) it writes the image at around 45mbps and reads to verify the write at well over 60mbps. Color me happy!
customer_reviews.author: S. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Don't go Samsung for sd
customer_reviews.text: I actually managed to receive a real Samsung Evo select. However when testing it's speed they where the worst I have seen with and SD card. 25-30 upload and download speed. I did over 10 tests. Don't say up to 100 if you can't event hit a third of those speeds. A waste of time and money. It's possible I recieved one from a slow batch of cards. In that case Samsung needs to work on there quality control. I love Samsung products and have them for TV and phones, and even ddr4 ram, and a Evo plus ssd in my laptop. All work wonderfully, there SD cards are just bad stick with other well know well tested brands.
customer_reviews.author: Addi

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and consistently fast
customer_reviews.text: I have nearly 2 dozen Samsung EVO and Pro microSD cards and they have been very reliable and consistently fast. Their USB flash drives are great as well! I have these (mix of EVO and PRO) microSD cards in Canon cameras, Fire tablet, Nintendo Switch, Hak5 LAN Turtle, Ubiquity UniFi Video Cloud Key gen2 Plus nvr, Wyze cameras, Roav dash cam, NUC, Intel Compute stick, Mazda Navigation, Zoom h1 mic, I think that's it. Samsung Bar usb flash drives are similar speed but in a nice aluminum usb stick format.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Hart

customer_reviews.title: works for GoPro Silver
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that he new GoPro that I purchased for my kids b-day did not come with any storage (my fault - should have read description better). I was happy to find this on sale for a few bucks off and the price was not too bad for a lot of storage that was the faster rating that can support higher resolution video. So far we have had no issues in a GoPro Silver and I would expect it should work OK in any GoPro or camera.
customer_reviews.author: Autobahn97

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good
customer_reviews.text: i just got it very recently and i'm very happy with it, my wife loves taking pictures so the capacity is very much appreciated and loved.. i've had one before that got corrupted after a few months and all my pictures just vanished.. i can always create new memories but there are some funny pictures with friends and family that can't be seen by anyone anymore.. and no don't suggest data recovery, i expect my stuff to work long enough before i start worrying about backing it up every week..
customer_reviews.author: Shan Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Adding my experience to real vs. fake
customer_reviews.text: Short version, I got a real one. After running h2testw on mine (a great little program that will see if what you got really has the capacity and speed advertised) it seems everything is good to go. The speed off of the one test was about 85% of the advertised speed but it's well within range and the discrepancy may be more an issue of my laptop or the connector being used to connect it to USB 3.0 than anything else. If things break soon I'll say. Until then, five stars.
customer_reviews.author: ProgearStorm

customer_reviews.title: This did not work for me.  Pay your money, take your chance.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the thought of sharing pictures with it. When it arrived, I couldn't get it to read in my desktop computer. Since then, I've tried it on three lap tops and two desk tops. It just doesn't work. I can no longer return it, so it looks as if I've wasted my money. My advise. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Tony R

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about buying this at first because of so many horror stories about fake memory cards, but luckily I received a genuine one. It works great. I've had no issues with my phone (Note 8) reading or recognizing the card, no phone crashes, or anything like that. Just be careful if not purchasing through amazon, some of the third party sellers are sending fake cards or cards claiming to have 128gb but really only have 16gb.
customer_reviews.author: ashley hudson

customer_reviews.title: Read Write problems aplenty.
customer_reviews.text: I bought thos card based on the samsung reputation and wow was i wrong. This card has read/write problems aplenty! Even after 5 reformats. Still problems persist. Errors deleting files. Errors writing to the card. Duplicate files. Files with 0.kb unreadable. I should have went with another brand. Ive always used sandisk in my devices. The samsung name and yes the price convinced me to buy it. I cannot in good faith reccommend thus card.
customer_reviews.author: P. Mistretta

customer_reviews.title: Great for Switch
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for use in my Nintendo Switch. I buy mostly digital and I like to have most of my games available so this was a natural choice for a reasonable price (wild how much SD card prices have come down). Overall it has been performing great with what seem to be decent speeds. Would definitely recommend this to anyone looking to expand their Switch storage.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I think this would have been amazing had it worked. I didn't need it immediately so I passed my return window, and when I tried it, nothing happened. Even tested it in the reader on my laptop. This may be the first Samsung product that didn't work for me. If they go on sale again, I may buy another, especially for the amount of storage. If that one works, I'll update the rating. Packaging and shipping were great, no problems there.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Died within a couple of months of light use, warranty replacement seems impossible
customer_reviews.text: I started getting errors with this thing requiring multiple reformats early on and now it is dead. Other micro SD cards have no problems in all the devices I tried this thing with. I have been trying to get Samsung warranty to respond for quite some time with no luck. I have had nothing but grief with Samsung products--I know others have the opposite experience--so for me they are a never again brand.
customer_reviews.author: bmoag

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, until...
customer_reviews.text: For almost four months, this worked perfectly to store all my music and downloaded podcasts (and some apps). Then, in the middle of listening to a podcast, my phone stopped recognizing it. I used several different adapters to try to get my computer to read it, and no luck there either. Sort of disappointing for a Samsung product. As far as I'm aware, there is very little you can do once the SD card stops being recognized--you can't format a card that doesn't show up anywhere! I guess I'll just replace it, which I did not expect to need to do less than four months in.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Just What I needed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to be able to put all of my music (18,000 songs with album art) onto a card on my Android phone so I could use Mediamonkey & forget about iTunes & my iPod. So the 256GB card was what I chose so I could have room left for misc photos etc. After 9 hours on a USB 2 port (slow) I synced 113GB of music over to the phone & it is flawless! I am so happy I got this card! Hurray for Mediamonkey & Android, bye bye Apple!
customer_reviews.author: G Mac

customer_reviews.title: Second time it failed.
customer_reviews.text: I sent my card for a replacement a couple of months after purchasing it do to it no longer being recognized on any of my devices/computers. six months later the replacement just died. I should have done more backups. :( (changed form one star to three) I must confess I believe I killed it by removing it before my phone was completely shut down. The screen was black however not powered off. Please be careful with this one.
customer_reviews.author: George F. Serr

customer_reviews.title: It works, but not correct product, not a 256GB chip as listed.
customer_reviews.text: When I put the chip into my PC to format it comes up as 238 GB, not 256. That's a loss of a full 18gb. No matter if I use FAT32, exFAT, NTFS, EXT, it won't format over 238 GB. Severe false advertising. Why not just sell it as a 240Gb chip instead of ripping people off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to use as extra storage for my Macbook Pro since it only has a 128gb hard drive. Used a standard micro sd adapter and it has been working great ever since. It has been over 2 years now, no issues of complaints. I don't usually transfer too many large files, so I can't speak for the transfer speeds. As far as extra storage goes, you can't beat this
customer_reviews.author: Toop

customer_reviews.title: Card Does Not Work: Phone Suggests to Insert Memory Card
customer_reviews.text: This memory card must be a fake because I've tried installing it in multiple phones and it does not recognize that a memory card is inserted. I tried encrypting the card as I've seen needed to be done. But when I select that option, the phone states to insert memory card. I bought this memory card 3 months ago and only now that I've already used up all my phone storage, I attempted to save files and pictures on my external memory, only to find out it does not exist.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Perfect / for Nintendo Switch
customer_reviews.text: Added this memory card for my son's Nintendo Switch. Worked like a charm for easy 2 second 'install' I simply inserted this card to the Nintendo Switch memory slot (located behind the 'kick stand' leg on the console) and then the Nintendo Switch immediately asked me to restart the console (like it is supposed to do.) Three seconds later, the card was installed just like that and recognized perfectly by the Nintendo Switch console for 100% no hassle. I ordered the 256GB card and it was a great value too.
customer_reviews.author: stars

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted 256Gig 100MBps MicroSD
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal! 256GB MicroSD is everything it was advertised to be. Getting 89MBps transfer rate WRITE, and about 98 MBps Read using an external MicroSD reader via USB3. That is close enough for me. Especially for the money. So the big B and little b are different just so you know. B when speaking of transfer is Bytes, where 'b' is bits' which is 8 times smaller than a byte. To translate to real-world numbers this card transfers just around 750 to 900 megabits per second which is almost the same raw speed as full Gigabit Ethernet. USB3 is required to read at this speed as USB 2.0Max speed is around 39MBps.
customer_reviews.author: David & Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Good card for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good price, good capacity and it works in the device it was purchased for so all good so far. If you are reading the other reviews about the capacity being "wrong", you have to first understand that "capacity" as listed on the packaging has some marketing built in and is slightly skewed for ease of understanding. All storage/memory manufacturers list the capacity as a multiple of Gigabytes (where a gigabyte equals 1 billion bytes). So 256GB = 256 Billion Bytes. In reality a gigabyte equals 1,073,741,824 bytes. Meaning the formatted size of this 256GB Card is 238.41GB.
customer_reviews.author: Nathen Fritzsche

customer_reviews.title: Full size, not cheap counterfeit like some sellers.
customer_reviews.text: I always check the size and performance of ram, USB and SD/MiniSD memory I buy... This seller is providing true, full specification units. My test found the chipcard had full capacity, without any errors in either write or repeated read tests. The tests can detect misrepresented memory as well as individual bad bits, and this passed all perfecetly. I will be buying more from this vendor when I move to my new cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ruined my vacation photos
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Samsung s9+. I wanted extra memory for a vacation. Half of the pictures I took would not save to this card. My phone took the pictures and "saved" them but there is an error when I try to view them. My phone's internal memory was full so i ended up losing half of the photos from my trip. I'm not sure if it's real samsung or counterfeit but if it's real i would expect it to work perfectly in a Samsung phone
customer_reviews.author: amazon lover

customer_reviews.title: Buyers beware FAKE micro sd card 256gb
customer_reviews.text: Got 2 256gb micro sd FAKE cards only getting 19 MBs read and 14 MBs write. Look else where.
customer_reviews.author: MiKeCooL

customer_reviews.title: Great for Switch modding
customer_reviews.text: I've used Samsung Evo Select 64GB cards on several small SBC computers such as the Raspberry Pi and they've always been fast and reliable. I wanted to mod my Switch to run Linux and wanted more storage so I got this 256GB card. It is just what I expected, same reliability and speed I'm used to but with more storage space. Linux boots quickly and programs load fast. Haven't tried it for normal Switch games but may repartition it so I can use it for both purposes.
customer_reviews.author: CalcProgrammer1

customer_reviews.title: Value For Price
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying memory in one form or another since 1990. Samsung's 256GB 100MB/s MicroSDXC EVO Select Memory Card was my latest purchase. To think we can now buy a 256GB memory card sized smaller than my little finger's nail for $40 is just crazy. But it works just fine in my new cell phone giving me a total 384GB of storage (the phone had 128GB of it's own memory). (not part of review - would you believe my first hard drive was the 5.25 inch format, holding a whopping 40 MB, yes I meant MegaBytes; and cost me $495.)
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: comparable to Sandisk Extreme, but more afforable.
customer_reviews.text: See the speed test comparison between Samsung 256GB 100MB/s (U3) vs Sandisk Extreme Plus. Similar performance. Samsung is more affordable.
customer_reviews.author: jojoo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I got this for my Nintendo Switch because 128GB just wasn't cutting it. Some titles are 30GB a piece, and I found myself having to struggle to decide which games got to live, and which games had to go. Doubling up to 256GB was great, and now I have a ton more options! Also, I ran the card through various tests on my computer, and it's real, and its capacity is accurate.
customer_reviews.author: DarkWestern

customer_reviews.title: 256gig good value for price 👌
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended, got the 256gig size and honestly this is great and a perfect complement to my s20+ (128gig). Look if you need extra storage on a camera or smart phone this is honestly the best bang for your buck. Transfer speed is just (EH) but gets the job done. Also I've read reviews were people get bogus micros where its not the true storage size. My advice is make sure to buy from Amazon LLC or is sold from if you will. As a lesser chance from getting a scam micro vs third party venders.
customer_reviews.author: Elwood

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Switch
customer_reviews.text: Needed storage for the nintendo switch for games and dlc and the Samsung cards come highly recommended for the switch. Plugged it into the micro sd slot and turned it on and was prompted that i needed an update which is it's way of telling you to format the card. Hit update and it was ready to go in about 60 seconds. Everything's downloaded to the card with no issues and has operated perfectly. Definately a must have
customer_reviews.author: Gary Ferrell

customer_reviews.title: Died in storage after removing from phone!
customer_reviews.text: Don't dismiss the frequent reports of these Samsung cards dying, just happened to my 8-month old card while in STORAGE after I removed it to switch out to a different, smaller card. Card is no longer even recognized as existing upon insertion into any device, phone, Windows laptop built-in card reader, external card reader. Utterly, completely DEAD. Not worth your money in potential grief. Save yourself the trouble and heartache, try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: dinosnake

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a Samsung Galaxy S10 phone. Works with no issues. I'm no techie, so all I'm concerned about was overall storage size and price, both of which worked for me. I did watch this item as the pricing tends to bounce around. I shoot photos and videos on my phone with it and have had no issues. Will buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: K. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: FAKE CARD straight from Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this card from Amazon directly not a third party seller. I noticed there was a sticker covering the back of the package where it would say where the card was manufactured. The package said Phillipines but the sticker covering said Korea. The card itself said Korea. This was red flag #1. The text on the back of the package was blurry. Samsung would not recognize the serial number from the card when I tried to register it for the 10 year warranty . All together I think I got a FAKE CARD. I was hoping by purchasing from Amazon that this would not be the case. I will be returning the card.
customer_reviews.author: Mark K

customer_reviews.title: The card works as stated
customer_reviews.text: So I have seen mixed reviews on this specific card due to fakes or non working cards but the card I received was in fact working, but as to if it's fake I can not say. This card reads and writes 4k video and pictures so it does work well and in my phone the note8 but the stated capacity is only 238gb not 256gb. Time will tell how the card works so I will update this if anything happens in the mean time
customer_reviews.author: The meyer family

customer_reviews.title: Not fast enough for 4k uhd 60fps
customer_reviews.text: Does not let u record in 4k 60fps on galaxy note 10plus so strange I figured 100mbps or I'm sorry 90mps write speed is fast enough to record it.... unfortunately for me I bought this specifically for trip to Italy so I can record videos at the highest resolution at 60fps since the regular uhd 30fps is super choppy on the galaxy phone guess gonna have to record internally then transfer to sd card 😑
customer_reviews.author: Nichita Galinschi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Nintendo Switch
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase! I bought this for my son's Nintendo Switch & it works great! People who have left poor reviews because they say it isn't compatible w/the Switch obviously have not done it correctly. It took us about 2 mins & ONLY that long because my son had put it in incorrectly. Otherwise it would have taken seconds lol. So, all in all this was a perfect purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Disario

customer_reviews.title: The best you can buy
customer_reviews.text: I love Samsung SSDs and memory products because they are rock solid reliable, fast and appropriately priced. These camera cards are perfect. They work great. Super fast. I am saving an HD live stream video dash cam flawlessly. Need I say more?
customer_reviews.author: Robert From NY

customer_reviews.title: Solved my space issue!
customer_reviews.text: First I had to google how to open the tray with a paperclip (Samsung 8+) and it took awhile but it worked. Then I had to search for videos on how to install the card into the tray - I couldn't get it to snap in and when I thought I did it right, it would fall out. After multiple attempts, it did finally snap in and I was able to insert it back into my phone. I figured something will go wrong, but so far it's working like a charm! No more low storage alerts! I've had it for a couple of weeks, so hopefully it will all remain good!
customer_reviews.author: KaBu

customer_reviews.title: has been through 4 phones and still going
customer_reviews.text: no issues at all, plenty of space for a lot of music, video downloads, google play music offline, etc, fast enough to work as the camera storage with no problems, I had previously purchased a Samsung 128gb pro thinking it would speed up my phone, so later when I got this I was afraid it would be slower, it is not, it works great
customer_reviews.author: Ashley T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Switch
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use as external storage for my Nintendo Switch, and it works perfectly. I had no issues getting the card to work with the gaming system and so far I have had zero issues with it reading the card. There is a bit more lag when you attempt to load a game off of the SD card, but it does not impede your gaming at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Roland

customer_reviews.title: Wow it really is a DOA card June 2019. Tested in countless devices and macs and nothing!
customer_reviews.text: Wow it really is a DOA card June 2019. I didnt think the other people knew what they were talking about. Tested in countless devices and macs and nothing! Samsung cards have always sucked for me but completely dead new is a record. Tried in Go Pros, Xiaomi Mijia Sphere 360 degree camera and both my macs and nothing acknowledges the card at all. Even in other adapters and Thunderbolt dock that has SD and microSD slots. Get another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Levi Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Yep, just what I thought.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what to say here. It works, was cheap and appears to be fast. I'm sure if you wait 6 months you could get double the storage for the same price but 256 will be more than sufficient in my new gopro. I would have liked to get a usb attachment but didn't want to pay extra. Overall, I got exactly what I ordered, a high quality card for a good price. (Slow clap for Samsung, again.)
customer_reviews.author: Tlaloc

customer_reviews.title: First DOA and Second not much better
customer_reviews.text: First thing I did was run h2testw which returned errors at different locations each time I ran it. Next tried to format using Windows Explorer - returned message saying "... corrupted and unreadable" after a 1.5 hour format. I've now returned my second (replacement) one. I was able to do a Quick Format and started using it as a File Backup on Windows. Soon (after several days) Windows reported errors on the 'drive'. I tried a full format - both as default exFat and NTFS. Both attempts returned 'Windows was unable to complete the format' message.
customer_reviews.author: San Francisco Ron

customer_reviews.title: SCAM!
customer_reviews.text: This was my worst online purchase of all time. I read some of the reviews and a lot of people seemed happy and a few said they had been scammed. I took a gamble. I was scammed. My computer wouldn't even recognize it had been plugged in. Just go to Best Buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but still a good deal
customer_reviews.text: I've copied many movies and show to this little card, about 190 Gbs so far. It can takes a second for the computer to read and if i am watching a large video file this can studder maybe every 5 - 30 minutes (where the screen freezes, but the new frames kinda work it out), it last for about 1-3 seconds, but does not happen too excessively and only on larger files. Kinda annoying but this little micro sd was half the price its usb counterpart, and by reviews much more flawless as well. For me I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Becoming a Fan of Micro SD
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Surface Pro 3 and from first glance, it looks and works amazingly. I am getting 70MB/s sustained write speed, sometimes bumping up to 72MB/s. This is a lot better than my previous card which was hovering at around 15-20MB/s and was not sustained at all, usually dropping below 5MB/s. Read speed with this card is hitting around 80MB/s. I cannot complain especially at the price point of $40 for 256GB.
customer_reviews.author: Mike-E

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for additional HD expansion on MacBoo Pro and Thunderbolt 3 Hub
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a new MacBook Pro 2017 and a HyperDrive Duo USB-C hub which has a microSD slot. My MBP has a 512GB SSD and I wanted an "external" drive for additional storage. I travel quite a bit and try to keep the number of external peripherals to a minimum. The Samsung 256GB EVO is very fast and is excellent for what I need. Compared to the SD slot on my older 2013 MacBook Pro there is no comparison. File copying and load times are incredibly quick. I can use it to store all my VMWare Fusion VM's without consuming my internal hard drive and performance is not compromised.
customer_reviews.author: Simple

customer_reviews.title: Much better than Sandisk
customer_reviews.text: I previously had used a Sandisk card with my Samsung phone and was having issues with image distortion and copying to computer. I upgraded to a new phone and had read that using a Samsung card was better. I have had this for months now and have been very pleased. It is speedy with no issues!
customer_reviews.author: HJ

customer_reviews.title: The card i was send was defective. When I returned it to the seller it apparently broke in the mail.
customer_reviews.text: And the supplier had the nerve to charge me a restocking fee. Clearly Samsung does not provide a guarantee to their retail seller. Dont buy this card. Terrible warrantee.
customer_reviews.author: diver

customer_reviews.title: Fast.  Great for security camera storage, and 24 MP photography
customer_reviews.text: I have bought many of these. They are in my wifi security cameras to provide 2 months of video recording storage at high-definition video. I also use these in my Sony A7 iii camera (one for photo, the other for video). I am able to take a 7 picture burst at 24 mega pixels before I see a buffer write slow-down. Considering that the UHS II increases this by an extra 3 pictures in the burst, but the same sung cards $400 less per SD card, I feel that these are the better value, I have not yet tried 4K video recording with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: The Key Master

customer_reviews.title: What is Best Buy?
customer_reviews.text: Best Buy is the place yougo to see what you want to order off Amazon! Low on disk space? This is the answer! I purchased a W10 Dell touchscreen tablet it had ONLY 128Gb internal storage,, this solved issue.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Tillman

customer_reviews.title: Small Size And Big Capacity
customer_reviews.text: This a rock solid micro sd data card. Installed it in my Samsung S6 tablet and works like a dream. Bought the 256 gig card and have had zero issues with it. You can load a ton of movies on this card and still have lots of space to spare! Data transfer rates aren't bad at all and even writing a 1 gig movie to it only takes about 30 or 40 seconds. Great product and value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Works well with the Nintendo Switch.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about two months ago to use for my Nintendo Switch. No problems with set up and haven't had any problems downloading and playing games. I've downloaded four games (including Divinity II: Original Sin) so far and have 215 GB free. I think 256 GB is an appropriate size to buy if you plan on downloading most of your games.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Great storage augmentation for a smart phone
customer_reviews.text: This SD card installed into my Samsung Galaxy S8+ easily and without any issues. After a quick format through the Android system, I used an app to transfer all my personal files to the SD card. By clearing up space on my phone's internal storage, I was able to alleviate some issues where my apps needed more available storage space. So far everything is operating smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: J-Pop

customer_reviews.title: great price - worked immediately
customer_reviews.text: We got 3 new smartphones for Christmas so finding a good deal on the SD card was a necessity! All three were recognized and worked the moment the phones rebooted. The camera app just asked if it was the default storage location. Have not used the adapters. The package isn't the easiest thing to open but I understand the need for such a tiny piece of technology.
customer_reviews.author: s27518

customer_reviews.title: GENUINE SAMSUNG HIGH SPEED MICRO SDXC
customer_reviews.text: Apparently the Samsung EVO Select is exclusive to Amazon, so you know it's authentic, and not some cheap knock-off/counterfeit. Very important these days. Cloned my Macbook Pro SSD to this little card, as backup before OS upgrade, without a hitch. It's recognized and bootable, so all's good. $59.99 price is competitive too. UPDATE: 12/7/18 Received second purchase of this item- pleased with both performance & cost. Provides cost effective boot backup of SSD running High Sierra.
customer_reviews.author: DESERT-TEK

customer_reviews.title: Great Micro SD
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly! It fit my Galaxy S7 with no issues at all, and I now don't have to worry about storage at all. I've downloaded a ton of videos off YouTube and Netflix, and it feels like I've barely touched it. I have hours of content for when I travel saved up on here now, and I could hold much, much more. If anyone travels for work, I highly recommend a large SD card to watch movies or videos on flights.
customer_reviews.author: Ben R

customer_reviews.title: Enough Capacity for my Music Collection
customer_reviews.text: I've ripped over 450 CDs to FLAC, and have them on my LG V20 phone. I know it's not new, but the phone still delivers great sound. I recently filled my 128 GB microSD, so I bought this to replace it. After I rebuild my turntable, I'll be able to rip my vinyl collection and store it too. It still amazes me that I can carry over 600 full lossless albums on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Roger M

customer_reviews.title: Something Reliable
customer_reviews.text: There are other good manufacturers/resellers of SD cards out there, but I chose the Samsung because this one is going into a Samsung phone. It works fine without any fuss. No formatting necessary unless you want something specific. I just stuck into the card holder and the phone recognized it immediately and walked me through saving data to the card. No problems with performance or reliability so far.
customer_reviews.author: T Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Great Capacity SD Cards!!!
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing two defective cards on eBay trying to avoid paying high prices and looking for a deal, I decided to try getting one on Amazon and I'm very glad I did. I thought that both mine and my wife's Samsung Galaxy Note 8 were the problem since neither SD card worked well in either phone. I started getting upset thinking that Samsung put it defective we send smartphones. Our pictures and videos wouldn't save or they would get corrupted. I'm so glad I bought two of these and they worked like a charm. Would definitely highly recommend this seller and products.
customer_reviews.author: JFREAK

customer_reviews.title: High Speed, Reliable Brand. This is my 2nd purchase of these! Same-Day Delivery!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd samsung Evo card. I got one last summer (128gb) for my note 9. Now I got a Nintendo Switch and needed an SD card. I was looking for a 128gb one. I purchased a 256gb one for only $50. Same day delivery too. I took my 128gb card and out it in my switch and used this 256gb for my note 9. I am transferring my old data from 128gb card to 256 GB card (about 100gb of stuff) and it's transferring fast! Was worried about receiving fake cards but I am extremely happy with this purchase. Now my Nintendo Switch and Note 9 phone has sufficient storage for games and music. Will buy again forsure!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for Capacity & Easy to Format
customer_reviews.text: Tons of storage and great value. Needed this specific item instead of a generic Samsung card reader and it was very easy to format (if needed) as any device I've used it with that needed a different format has automatically prompted me to do so, and I've never had any problems with changing format or interfering with memory. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cortney

customer_reviews.title: Fake sd card
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card a few months ago and finally got around to using it in my ps vita. Whenever I would add anything to the card after about 30gb it would instantly delete once inserted into my device. This leads me to believe that this is not an authentic sd card or it is broken. Either way not satisfied with my purchase and will not buy an SD card on Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Extra onboard storage.
customer_reviews.text: I brought this to increase storage on my Surface Pro 7. Simply put, it works well. Note: for Windows users, format this card in NTFS to match the main hard drive to improve file transfers between drives.
customer_reviews.author: PapaGeorge

customer_reviews.title: Good Addition to my Cellphone
customer_reviews.text: I added this SDHC card to my LG V40 ThinQ, maximum capacity for this phone. It recognized it immediately, and I was able to add a large collection of music MP3 files to it with ease, and the transfer was quick. I moved my photos as well, and freed space on the phone, allowing me to better organize my photos. I still have ample amount of storage. The response is no different than the phone itself. I think I made a good selection.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph McCray

customer_reviews.title: FUN FACT !!
customer_reviews.text: The one Terabyte Micro secure digital cards are starting to hit the shelves, (very Pricey). A One TB card will hold 5.88 million Commodore 64 disks! 170K per disk, (single sided), seemed like a lots of storage back then. I have purchased several of these Samsung 256 Gig cards and they all work flawlessly. The Price on these are now less than one third of what I Paid for my first one. Fast, Vast Capacity, Reliable and Really Great Prices!
customer_reviews.author: Sluggo

customer_reviews.title: Tired of running out of space on your phone? This does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of running out of space on my phone (podcasts, Netflix and Amazon Prime for offline viewing, etc), so I decided to upgrade from 64gb to 256gb. I now never feel like I'm about to run out of storage. Speeds are high enough I haven't had any issues shooting video or pictures (I don't have a fancy phone, though).
customer_reviews.author: Toozinger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Nintendo Switch
customer_reviews.text: I got the 256GB one on sale for my Nintendo Switch, and it works perfectly. No buffering issues, no slow loading screens (it's about as fast as my old one, and as fast as normal game cards). Copying game data from one card to another is easy, independent of how this card performs - just connect your old SD card to your computer, copy the files to a location on your computer, swap to the other SD card, then copy the files back.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

product_meta.title: Samsung (MB-ME256GA/AM) 256GB 100MB/s (U3) MicroSDXC EVO Select Memory Card with Full-Size Adapter
product_meta.description: Capacity:256 GB| Style:Card and Adapter OnlySimply the right card. With stunning speed and reliability, the Samsung 256GB MicroSD EVO Select Memory Card lets you get the most out of your devices. Whether you are a power user or simply want to expand your device memory, this MicroSD card gives you the advantage of ultra-fast read & write speeds of up to 100MB/s & 90MB/s, respectively. It’s also compatible with all MicroSD and wide range of full-size SD applications. Feel confident to capture, store and transfer Full HD videos, photos, music and other large files effortlessly. With massive amounts of storage, you can go ahead and savor all of what life has to offer. Your memories and adventures are irreplaceable, and now unforgettable. Backed by 4-proof protection, this card keeps your data safe against water, extreme temperatures, and other harsh conditions. Actual storage capacity may be lower than the labeled capacity; Part of the storage may be used for system files and other storage control purposes. Non-operating Temperature: -40°F to 185°F.
feature_bullets: Ideal for recording 4K UHD video: Samsung MicroSD Evo is perfect for high res photos, gaming, music, tablets, laptops, action cameras, dslr’s, drones, smartphones (Galaxy S10, S10+, S10e, S9, S9+, Note9, S8, S8+, Note8, S7, S7 Edge, etc.), Android devices and more
Enhanced read write speeds: Sequential read and write performance levels of up to 100MB/S and 90MB/S, respectively
Built to last reliability: Shock proof memory card is also water proof, temperature proof, X Ray proof and magnetic proof
Extended compatibility: Includes full size adapter for use in cameras, laptops and desktop computers
10 year limited warranty: 10 year limited warranty does not extend to Dashcam, CCTV, surveillance camera and other write-Intensive uses; Warranty for SD adapter is limited to 1 year
